quotes.quote: When you get married, your loyalty, first and foremost, is to your spouse, and to the family that you create together.
I'll take fifty percent efficiency to get one hundred percent loyalty.
Total loyalty is possible only when fidelity is emptied of all concrete content, from which changes of mind might naturally arise.
An ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
Loyalty will not permit envy, hate, and uncharitableness to creep into our public thinking.
So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family, that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty.
We both have a great loyalty to it, and I think that it's important to give it our best shot.
You've got to give loyalty down, if you want loyalty up.
Loyalty means nothing unless it has at its heart the absolute principle of self-sacrifice.
When does loyalty become martyrdom?
Loyalty is something you give regardless of what you get back, and in giving loyalty, you're getting more loyalty; and out of loyalty flow other great qualities.
Unless you can find some sort of loyalty, you cannot find unity and peace in your active living.
Lack of loyalty is one of the major causes of failure in every walk of life.
A family in harmony will prosper in everything.
The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof.

Loyalty means giving me your honest opinion, whether you think I'll like it or not. Disagreement, at this state, stimulates me. But once a decision is made, the debate ends. From that point on, loyalty means executing the decision as if it were your own.
You cannot buy loyalty; you cannot buy the devotion of hearts, minds, and souls. You have to earn these things.
Loyalty isn't grey. It's black and white. You're either loyal completely, or not loyal at all.
You don't earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day- by- day.
Loyalty is a characteristic trait. Those who have it, give it free of charge.
Be loyal to those who are not present. In doing so, you build the trust of those who are present.
Loyalty is what makes us trust, Trust is what makes us stay, Staying is what makes us love, and love is what gives us hope.
Loyalty is the highest virtue taught by abusers, and used as a control tool.
We are all in the same boat, in a stormy sea, and we owe each other a terrible loyalty.
Where there is loyalty, weapons are of no use.
The whole point of loyalty was not to change: stick with those who stuck with you.
Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable than fidelity. Faithfulness and truth are the most sacred excellences and endowments of the human mind.
The only true test of loyalty is fidelity in the face of ruin and despair.
I'm very loyal in relationships. Even when I go out with my mom I don't look at other moms.
The strength of a family, like the strength of an army, is in its loyalty to each other.
I don't like to give up on people when they need someone not to give up on them.
Birds of a feather flock together.
A healthy loyalty is not passive and complacent, but active and critical.
Loyalty is a major force making for unity in any life-even in the existence of a civilization.... It gives point and flavor, most of all meaning, to a life or a culture.
There is one element that is worth its weight in gold and that is loyalty. It will cover a multitude of weaknesses.
Loyalty will not permit envy, hate, and uncharitableness to creep into our public thinking.
He speaketh not; and yet there lies a conversation in his eyes.
It is better to be faithful than famous.
Commitment is an act, not a word.
Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
Faithfulness lives where love is stronger than instinct.
Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
I like people who are loyal to me, and I like to be loyal, too.
It is the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires. It must abandon itself to its master passion.
Very few people deserted me when I went to prison. They stayed loyal.
A little thing is a little thing, but faithfulness in little things is a great thing.
It takes a deep commitment to change and an even deeper commitment to grow.
Commitment. This is my favorite word because in some way, people who are committed are always much more interesting and much more reliable, and much more, I would say, deep than people who are not.
It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.
If by my life or death I can protect you, I will.
